CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are:

1. PQCDTB
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM
4. P3HT
5. PCZDTB

These are the names of the materials used in the fabrication of the photovoltaic devices that are being compared in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Material Name in the given paragraph:

1. PQCDTB
2. PC61BM
3. PC71BM

These three entities are the names of materials used in the fabrication of photovoltaic devices, and are therefore relevant to the context of Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's a Markdown table with the valid entities in the "Material Name" column:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PQCDTB |
| PC61BM |
| PC71BM |

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. PQCDTB showed high FF than PCZDTB due to decrease of series resistance by self - organization of quinacridone unit. 9 Figure 5b showed the external quantum efficiency ( EQE ) data of the fabricated device. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. The photovoltaic devices with PC71BM as an acceptor showed higher EQE values than those with PC61BM as an acceptor , although they absorbed photons in the same range of the solar spectra. This was because PC71BM has a stronger UV - vis absorption property than does PC61BM in the visible region , especially near 500 nm. 30 Hence , the PCE improved with an increase in J SC . In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

* PQCDTB
* PC61BM
* PC71BM
* P3HT
* PCZDTB
2. Identify the property names mentioned in the paragraph:

* open-circuit voltage (VOC)
* short-circuit current (JSC)
* fill factor (FF)
* power conversion efficiency (PCE)
* external quantum efficiency (EQE)
* HOMO level
* series resistance

Note: HOMO level is a property of a material, but it is not a property name in the classical sense. It is a measure of the highest occupied molecular orbital energy level of a material.

3. Identify the property values mentioned in the paragraph:

* VOC = 0.76 V, 0.79 V
* JSC = 4.4 mA cm^-2, 5.6 mA cm^-2
* FF = 47.5%, 55.8%
* PCE = 1.6%, 56%
* EQE = 38%, 41%, 48%
* HOMO level = -5.53 eV, -4.9 eV
* Series resistance = 31 Ω/cm^2, 27 Ω/cm^2, 320 Ω/cm^2, 62 Ω/cm^2

Note: The property values are not explicitly mentioned in the paragraph, but they can be inferred from the context.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. VOC (open-circuit voltage)
2. JSC (short-circuit current)
3. FF (fill factor)
4. PCE (power conversion efficiency)
5. EQE (external quantum efficiency)
6. HOMO level

I have removed the following entities that do not clearly refer to Property Name of Material:

1. PC61BM
2. PC71BM
3. P3HT
4. PCZDTB

These entities are mentioned in the paragraph, but they do not directly refer to Property Name of Material. PC61BM and PC71BM are mentioned as acceptors, and P3HT is mentioned as a comparison material, but their properties are not explicitly mentioned. PCZDTB is mentioned as a donor material, but its properties are not explicitly mentioned either.

Paragraph: The devices are structured as As shown in Figure 5a and Table 3 , the device that blended PQCDTB and PC61BM in a 1 : 1 ratio had an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.76 V , a short - circuit current ( J SC ) of 4.4 mA cm^-2 , a fill factor ( FF ) of 47.5% and a power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) of 1.6% . In the device that blended the PQCDTB and PC71BM in a 1 : 1 ratio , V OC , J SC , and FF were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , and 55.8% , respectively. In terms of PCE , approximately 56% was improved with 2.5% , compared with the device in which the PC61BM was applied as an acceptor. Because PC71BM is greater than PC61BM in terms of photon absorption at 400-500 nm , it was able to improve the PCE by increasing J SC . 6 The V oc of PQCDTB was greater than the widely known poly(3-hexylthiophene) , P3HT ( V oc = 0.5 - 0.6 V ). This type of result was obtained because PQCDTB ( -5.53 eV ) has a lower HOMO level than P3HT ( -4.9 eV ). 19,24 The value of FF for PQCDTB ( FF = 55.8% ) increased by 39% compared to PCZDTB ( FF = 40.1% ). The series resistance at PQCDTB and PC71BM ratios of 1 : 1 and 1 : 2 , as shown in Table 3 , was 31 and 27 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. In contrast , the series resistance at PCZDTB and PC71BM ratio of 1 : 1 and 1 : 4 was 320 , 62 Ω / cm^2 , respectively. The series resistance of PQCDTB exhibited low value compared to that of PCZDTB. The decrease of series resistance could increase FF. When PQCDTB was used as a donor and PC61BM and PC71BM were used as acceptors , the device had 38% and 41% EQE at 480 nm , respectively. In a device that used PCZDTB as a donor , an EQE of 48% was observed at 440 nm. Interestingly , λ max was blue - shifted by -30 nm because of the low π-π stacking and the weak intermolecular interaction of PCZDTB compared with PQCDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Identify the material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* open-circuit voltage (VOC)
* short-circuit current (JSC)
* fill factor (FF)
* power conversion efficiency (PCE)
* external quantum efficiency (EQE)
* series resistance (Rs)
2. Identify the values of these material properties mentioned in the paragraph:

* VOC: 0.76 V, 0.79 V
* JSC: 4.4 mA cm^-2, 5.6 mA cm^-2
* FF: 47.5%, 55.8%
* PCE: 1.6%, 56%
* EQE: 38%, 41%, 48%
* Rs: 31 Ω/cm^2, 27 Ω/cm^2, 320 Ω/cm^2, 62 Ω/cm^2
3. Identify the units of these material properties:

* VOC: Volts (V)
* JSC: Amperes per square centimeter (mA cm^-2)
* FF: Percentage (%)
* PCE: Percentage (%)
* EQE: Percentage (%)
* Rs: Ohms per square centimeter (Ω/cm^2)

So, the values of material properties in the paragraph are:

* VOC = 0.76 V, 0.79 V
* JSC = 4.4 mA cm^-2, 5.6 mA cm^-2
* FF = 47.5%, 55.8%
* PCE = 1.6%, 56%
* EQE = 38%, 41%, 48%
* Rs = 31 Ω/cm^2, 27 Ω/cm^2, 320 Ω/cm^2, 62 Ω/cm^2
